meanings.definition: A breed of dog known for its small size and distinctive ears.
meanings.sent1: My neighbor has two cute pinschers that love to play in the park.
meanings.sent2: The pinschers at the dog show were well-behaved and adorable.
meanings.sent3: The pinschers in the pet store were having a barking contest with the poodles.
meanings.sent4: Her pinschers were like little furry acrobats, jumping around the living room.
meanings.sent5: The pinschers' ears were so big they looked like they could fly away.

meanings.definition: A type of tool used for gripping or holding objects.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic used a pair of pinschers to tighten the bolts on the car engine.
meanings.sent2: I couldn't find the pinschers in the toolbox, so I had to use my hands to twist the wire.
meanings.sent3: He pretended the pinschers were a giant monster trying to grab his sandwich.
meanings.sent4: The pinschers of the crane reached out and lifted the heavy load effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: Her grandfather's old pinschers were rusty but still strong enough to grip the stubborn nail.

meanings.definition: A person who pinches or nips someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The little pinschers in the playground were always getting into mischief.
meanings.sent2: The pinschers at the party thought it was funny to sneak up and pinch people.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous pinschers stole a cookie from the jar when no one was looking.
meanings.sent4: She jokingly called her brother a pinschers for teasing her about the movie ending.
meanings.sent5: The naughty pinschers left tiny bite marks on the edges of the papers.
